moves.1. c4: This is probably the most aggressive and risky game I have played for a long time. It happened in my Halibut gambit tournament.
moves.4... b4 5. Nd5 c5: I think I would have been tempted by e6.
moves.6. d4 e6: It was around this point that I decided to go for it. I think having such an advanced position for my knight went to my head and I thought I could see all sorts of possibilities.
moves.7. Bg5: Obviously if the queen takes the bishop I can fork King and rook with my knight and may get to develop my remaining knight with tempo to f3
moves.7... f6 8. Nxf6+: Against a player ranked so much higher than me this is a high risk gambit.
moves.8... Nxf6: I was hoping for (though not expecting) gxf6 as I then have Qh5+
moves.9. e5: Trying to maintain the pressure on black.
moves.9... h6 10. exf6: I didn't want to retreat the bishop as g5 might follow if I did and that would give black advanced pawns on the kings side where I was looking to castle in future
moves.10... hxg5 11. f7+: Black may have been expecting fxg7 but I have another plan which will regain my lost material and possibly more, the bonus with this was that black couldn't castle - not that he was likely to now
moves.11... Kxf7: Black can't afford to leave one of my pawns so far advanced so has little choice
moves.12. Qf3+ Qf6 13. Qxa8: Suddenly I am ahead on material with the chance of more. Black can no longer castle and  and I need to work out how to take advantage of the position
moves.13... Qxd4: I was really expecting something like Bd6 here, though black was trying to keep his advanced pawns together, they could still yet prove a thorn in my side.
moves.14. Rd1: I'm still not sure that the simple Qxb8 wouldn't have been better here, in the end I decided to keep trying to pressure black. I figured that he would be tempted with Qxb2 partly to equalise on material but also because it means that his c and b pawns look a lot more threatening then.
moves.14... Qxb2 15. Bb5: Looking to develop here but again the simple Qxb8 or Nf3 may have been better. I wanted to preserve my a pawn as I may need it to keep the black pawns back a little.
moves.15... Qe5+ 16. Kf1: I didn't want to block as I wanted to develop my knight to f3 threatening check with Nxg5
moves.16... Qc7 17. Qf3+: With blacks queen there my queen is better off somewhere else. I wanted to try to keep black under pressure
moves.17... Kg8: This works well for me as I still have my lsb and am hoping to make good use of it
moves.18. Nh3: Aiming at g5 with the simple threat of Qf7
moves.18... Bb7 19. Qb3: This foils my immediate plan but now I am looking at another. If I can get my knight to g5 then a sacrifice on d7 could be nasty for black with Qxe6 threatened
moves.19... Bxg2+: I'd completely missed this nice move which allows black to gain a pawn
moves.20. Kxg2 Qb7+ 21. f3 Qxb5 22. Nxg5: I am very happy with my knight here
moves.22... c4 23. Qe3 Qa6: Black now wants my a pawn so that he can escape but I think this is a blunder
moves.24. Qf4: reverts to my earlier threat of Qf7#, as far as I can see the only way to slow this down is something like ... Qxa2+, Rd2, Qxd2, Qxd2 with more material loss to follow.
moves.24... Qxa2+ 25. Kf1: Now things are really looking up for me, black cannot check and I have mate in one
moves.25... Rh6: I don't understand this move, I guess he was looking at Rf6 and had missed my threat.
